meanings.definition: The practice of lending money in exchange for personal property as security.
meanings.sent1: Pawnbrokings can help people get quick cash by using their belongings as collateral.
meanings.sent2: She decided to visit the pawnbrokings shop to pawn her old jewelry for some extra money.
meanings.sent3: The pawnbrokings business was booming, with customers trading their items for loans.
meanings.sent4: In a world where trust is scarce, pawnbrokings serve as a bridge between those in need and financial stability.
meanings.sent5: The concept of pawnbrokings dates back centuries, showing its enduring importance in society.

meanings.definition: The business of operating as a pawnbroker.
meanings.sent1: His family has been in the pawnbrokings trade for generations, running a successful shop in town.
meanings.sent2: The pawnbrokings industry requires a good understanding of the value of various items.
meanings.sent3: When asked what he did for a living, he proudly declared, 'I'm in the pawnbrokings business!'
meanings.sent4: The pawnbrokings world is filled with stories of unique items and interesting customers.
meanings.sent5: She found herself drawn to the pawnbrokings field, fascinated by the history and transactions.
